page.title: 06VILLAGE MAGAZINE THE STAR
page.content: THE STAR IS A VILLAGE NEWSPAPER WHICH GOES TO THE VILLAGES OF SCROOBY, TORWORTH AND RANSKILL.THE EDITORS ARE BARRY PRATER AND ROBIN SWINGLER.IT IS DELIVERED TO ALL THE HOUSES IN THE THREE VILLAGES,WHICH IS A TOTAL OF ABOUT SEVEN HUNDRED HOUSES.THE STAR IS FREE TO THE PEOPLE IN THE VILLAGES,AND IT COSTS ABOUT Â£1000 TO MAKE EACH YEAR.THE FIRST COPY WAS ISSUED ON THE FIRST OF MAY, 1984.IT HAS IN IT, THINGS FROM CHILDREN, SUCH AS DRAWINGS. THERE ARE ADVERTISEMENTS AND NEWS FROM THE PARISH COUNCILS. IN EACH COPY, THERE ARE ABOUT 20 PAGES, AND THE MONEY TO MAKE THE NEWSPAPER COMES FROM DONATIONS, ADVERTISEMENTS AND THE PARISH COUNCILS. THE STAR NEWSPAPER COMES OUT EVERY MONTH.
